page.title: 08WINLATON'S GHOSTS & WITCHES
page.content: The ghost is said to appear on the site of a flour mill on the River Derwent.Anne a pretty twenty five year old was housekeeper to her uncle John Walker, the mill owner. She disappeared without trace. Her spirit gave the miller the circumstances of her death. She had been murdered with a pick making five wounds in her head.Afterwards she was thrown into a pit. Her murderers Sharp and Walker were also named. The body was found where the ghost had stated. The evidence appears to have been convincing as Sharp and Walker were executed in 1631. Hagg's Hill is reputed to have sinister connections with a coven of witches.However, this legend may be based on the misunderstood meaning of Hagg which means "boggy" ground.
